name: Clinical De-identification
short_description:
The Clinical De-identification (Clinical De-id) tool is designed to remove Protected Health Information from unstructured clinical notes.

This command line tool was developed as part of the i2b2/UTHealth 2014 challenge* and has been extended with a UK-specific component validated using a dataset from a UK institution.

Currently, this tool is available as per request. Please contact the author (a [dot] dehghan [at] manchester [dot] ac [dot] uk) for a copy of this tool. 


*The ClinicalDe-id has been described in details in:
Dehghan et al. (2015) Combining Knowledge- and  Data-driven Methods for De-identification of Clinical Narratives. Submitted.
summary: A de-identification tool for removing Protected Health Information.
